content:
Meeting in 15 minutes. :wave:

Agenda:

  • Triage (before sync)
  • Roadmap Projects + Projects blog post
  • Assigning / Claiming issues

Btw what is the best way to suggest an additional topic for these meetings? I would like to maybe talk about the issue workflow at some point as it seems a bit different for each issue. A lot of issues with the label first-good-issue have no one assigned, but they have a comment that someone wants to work on it. I remember finding it a bit frustrating to find an issue which I can work on at the start as I had to read through each comment section. Having a defined issue workflow that we can reference could maybe improve this.

(I'm sorry if this is the wrong place/time to bring this up :sweat_smile: )

So at the end of a meeting there is a poll, where you press on an emote if you want to bring up another topic.

If you want to put something on the agenda, you can eiher write me directly or, like you just did on the meeting placeholder (that I will be put up the day before in the future)
@T-clippy meeting time
So let's start with triage: @Cameron Steffen @Takayuki Nakata (or anyone else) any notable issues in the last two weeks?
May want to wait on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/81176 before sync. Should be merged soon.
Thanks! that should be merged before Thursday. :+1:
I don't have those issues.

I think we can directly address what @xFrednet brought up:

If someone writes that they want to work on an issue, they should either claim it with @rustbot claim or someone of us should assign them.
@xFrednet do you think this would help? Or do you have other ideas how we could handle this?
it looks like the majority of issue labels are triage
That would also be my suggestion. I think it would be good to add a note about @rustbot claim to the documentation and maybe point the option out the next time somebody asks if they can have an issue
Yeah, we should make this more prominent. I think currently we're having something like "just write a comment if you want to work on it" in the documentation.
Okay, I can update that in the documentation :upside_down:
Thanks!
add to this section I suppose

oliver said:

it looks like the majority of issue labels are triage

what do you mean by that?
Do we maybe also want to go though the current first good issues and update them?
That would be a bit of work though :thinking:

Another thing I want to bring up is: @Cameron Steffen @Takayuki Nakata can you add difficulty levels to the issues? (good-first-issue, E-medium, E-hard) I know that it can be hard to judge that sometimes, but it isn't that bad if it is labeled "wrong".

xFrednet said:

Do we maybe also want to go though the current first good issues and update them?

If someone wants to do that, sure :)
big +1
Great, in that case I would @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

If someone wants to do that, sure :)
This would probably also include asking them if they are still working on this as same comments are of old

flip1995 said:

oliver said:

it looks like the majority of issue labels are triage

what do you mean by that?

I think there could be a label for issues which would be assigned
or mentored depending on who is involved

something to indicate someone has it on their todo's
but maybe isn't working on it actively at the moment
Wouldn't that be covered by assigning someone?
Not up until the point someone asks for the assignment
I think it's reasonable to expect (new) contributors to be able to figure out if an issue assignment is stale, rather than expecting maintainers to unassign.

xFrednet said:

This would probably also include asking them if they are still working on this as same comments are of old

I think we can assume, that if someone hasn't opened a PR a month after claiming an issue, it isn't really assigned anymore
I think it's more a question of indication of priorities

Well the question is what the label should say? Someone should be assigned to it if it's not free for others to take even if development hasn't started yet. Having a label for that case feels a bit weird to me

Ok, next topic: Roadmap projects: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/projects/3

I claimed clippy#6627 (rust roadmap team documentation). I'm also interested in the false positive one. Did you have a chance in looking into the tracking issues and thinking about a issue you are interested in?

I think it might be labelled 'mentored' if it's something on someone's
todo list but they haven't gotten to it yet, or might not ever
I think a mentored label might make sense. But then again, good-first-issues are always "mentored" by someone.
About the tracking issues: It is not expected, that you will do all the work, but that you will provide mentorship for the project, which should reduce the amount of work.
I also want to write a blog post, that Clippy has those long-term projects, we're looking for help with, but first I want to assign someone to those issues.
I have spoken with people who did not know that those issues were mentored, so...

Roadmap projects

I happy take up clippy#5394 if no one else want's it? I'm a bit unsure about the last Point

Better integrate cargo dev in rust-lang/rust so that commands are also usable there

But I could work until that point and then ask for help if that's okay with all of you? :upside_down:
Yeah, I just put them out there, so we can find team members that can mentor them

xFrednet said:

Roadmap projects

I happy take up clippy#5394 if no one else want's it? I'm a bit unsure about the last Point

Better integrate cargo dev in rust-lang/rust so that commands are also usable there

But I could work until that point and then ask for help if that's okay with all of you? :upside_down:

Yeah sure, that would be great! @Philipp Hansch already looked into getting cargo dev bless to work in rustc IIRC.
Yes, I was actually thinking of adding bless support to our compiletest library, so that it is more similar to rustc's bless implementation

llogiq said:

I have spoken with people who did not know that those issues were mentored, so...

I got some great mentoring from flip1995 on my first issue. But I get that it's not 100% clear where to ask for the help. Just writing in the issue worked fine for me. I might add a comment about that to the documentation while I'm adding the @rustbot claim comment. Is there a proffered way how they should contact the mentors?
I will open a separate zulip thread about that, it's not for this meeting, I think :)
So if someone wants to take up an issue, please let me know (or assign yourself). Otherwise, I will write you directly ;)
Thank you @Philipp Hansch

xFrednet said:

llogiq said:

I have spoken with people who did not know that those issues were mentored, so...

I got some great mentoring from flip1995 on my first issue. But I get that it's not 100% clear where to ask for the help. Just writing in the issue worked fine for me. I might add a comment about that to the documentation while I'm adding the @rustbot claim comment. Is there a proffered way how they should contact the mentors?

They can just ping a team member (maybe we should keep a list of active members somewhere) or open a WIP PR
So if no one is interested in taking up a tracking issue right now, we can @triagebot end-meeting and postpone this.

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I think it might make sense to focus on a few of the roadmap topics at once, rather than spreading out everyone at the beginning
Yeah, I marked them with the P-* labels. We should first address the P-high ones. But I would like to have a specific person assigned to it anyway, so that someone has an overview of the issue.
Alright, that's all for today! Thanks everyone for attending :wave:
Thanks for running the meeting as well as all the tracking issues :blue_heart:
Yup, Thank you @flip1995 !! :upside_down:

flip1995 said:

Thanks! that should be merged before Thursday. :+1:

Famous last words :big_smile:
The count is now 10 failed rollups. My PR is RADIOACTIVE :radioactive:
